name: Brand

topics.response_text: Oh, no reason. Just asking. I haven't seen you before, that's all.

topics.topic_text: Why should I tell you anything?
topics.response_text: Hey now, why so angry? I'm just asking some questions, no reason to jump down my throat. Never mind, then.

topics.topic_text: Why do you want to know?
topics.response_text: Well, since you might be able to help me, I'll let you in on a little secret: the slaves are always planning all sorts of things.{Speech Challenge (1930454888)}

topics.topic_text: I'm here to find a cure for the mutations.
topics.response_text: Oh. Oh? A cure? That is very interesting. I'll be sure to note that.
Hrm. Well, let me know if you do.

topics.topic_text: I'm from outside The Pitt. I'm here to help free the slaves.
topics.response_text: From outside The Pitt? That's new. I heard there might be someone from far away showing up.
I guess that shouldn't surprise anyone. The bosses all thought they were up to something.

topics.topic_text: Wernher is trying to free the slaves.
topics.response_text: That figures. Must be why the bosses hate him so much.
I knew that bastard was up to something. Finally! After all he's done to me, I can get him!

topics.topic_text: I need a weapon. Where can I find Marco?
topics.response_text: You're looking for Marco, hrm? What's he up to?
You're new, aren't you? Are you here from the Erie Stretch? The Capital Wasteland? Ronto? Where's home?

description:
Brand is a 35 year-old Caucasian Male.

A Pitt slave who has betrayed his fellow workers by becoming a snitch for the raiders. He receives special treatment and extra rations in exchange for information about any potential slave uprisings.

Brand's Personality: Self-serving and pragmatic, Brand prioritizes his own survival and comfort above all else. He's opportunistic and willing to betray others for personal gain, showing little remorse for his actions.

Brand's Backstory: Brand was once just another slave in The Pitt, toiling away in the mills like everyone else. However, he recognized an opportunity to improve his own miserable conditions by offering his services as an informant to the raiders. Now, he lives a slightly better life than his fellow slaves, enjoying extra rations and lighter work duties, all while secretly reporting on any whispers of rebellion.
